title: Refused my mother to let me touch me between my legs today. She's now pouting and told me that I can never hug her again. Lol

author: blackcrowwhitetail
text: Good for you for standing up to her. No normal person ever would touch someone there. I bet she never did it while there were people who are not family members present because she knew it was wrong.

author: chatminteresse
text:
Yes, exactly. Good for you and your autonomy.

Tbh, she probably does weird controlling shit while hugging too, so you might be dodging a bullet. Find chosen family who respect your autonomy for hugs.

I used to go to school and share great hugs with my friends.

author: BlueberrySnapple
text:
>Good for you for standing up to her. No normal person ever would touch someone there. I bet she never did it while there were people who are not family members present because she knew it was wrong.

Which reminds me of the saying, "we are only as sick as our secrets." To me, that includes secrets that others are trying to make me keep.

author: GoldenAlexanders
text: I have to disagree. Imagine if it were OP's dad taking these actions - that is pedophilic. There are women who are pedophiles, and OP's mother is one.

author: [deleted]
text: That also sounded weird to me. :\\ I've been noticing more and more weird comments like this, trying to excuse this kind of behavior whenever someone mentions sexual abuse on this sub. It correlates with the number of real survivors on here connecting the dots of their abuse, and realizing they had a pedophile as a parent.

author: Zamboniqueen
text: A relationship between spouses is vastly different than that of a parent and child. It’s okay to touch your spouse sexually with their consent. It is NOT okay to touch your child sexually.

author: Zamboniqueen
text:
I get that. Even so, it was a weirdly inappropriate comment to make given the overall conversation happening here. Spousal touching wasn’t being discussed. Unless I’m incorrect, “no normal person would do that “ was in reference to a parent in a parent/child relationship.

I think you’re being downvoted because your comment came across as flippant and disrespectful given the nature of the conversation.

author: Zamboniqueen
text: It just wasn’t an appropriate comment to make given the conversation.

author: Mercinary-G
text:
Defensiveness is in action. You made a mistake. Forgive yourself and use this as an opportunity to recognise how defensiveness makes you double down and become more isolated and angry when a simple mistake could easily be sorted.  We all do it.

To clarify, you think your interpretation of “any normal person “ is absolute. It is not given the context of the original post.

author: thecourageofstars
text:
This comment has been removed because it goes against our rule, "no advocating abusive practices". This situation is clearly not the same as yours where consent is given. Regardless, it's inappropriate to make the situation about you right now, and it doesn't help to support OP.

This is the fourth time you've broken our rules, and you insisted on pushing back and being snarky/unkind to other users. You've been permanently banned.
